t: Psalm 22
From Suffering to Praise
For the choir director: according to “The Deer of the Dawn.” A psalm of David.
My*pn God, my God, why have you abandoned me? Why*ln are you so far from my deliverance and*ln from my words of groaning?
My*ln God, I cry by day, but you do not answer, by*ln night, yet I have no rest.
But*ln you are holy, enthroned*ln on the praises of Israel.
Our*ln ancestors trusted in you; they*ln trusted, and you rescued them.
They*ln cried to you and were set free; they*ln trusted in you and were not disgraced.
But*pn I am a worm and not a man, scorned*ln by mankind and despised by people.
Everyone*ln who sees me mocks me; they*ln sneer and shake their heads:
“He*ln relies on the Lord;*s let*ln him save him; let*ln the Lord*s rescue him, since*ln he takes pleasure in him.”
It*pn was you who brought me out of the womb, making*ln me secure at my mother’s breast.
I*ln was given over to you at birth; you*ln have been my God from my mother’s womb.
Don’t*pn be far from me, because distress is near and*ln there’s no one to help.
Many*pn bulls surround me; strong*ln ones of Bashan encircle me.
They*ln open their mouths against me — lions,*ln mauling and roaring.
I*ln am poured out like water, and*ln all my bones are disjointed; my*ln heart is like wax, melting*ln within me.
My*ln strength is dried up like baked clay; my*ln tongue sticks to the roof of my mouth. You*ln put me into the dust of death.
For*ln dogs have surrounded me; a*ln gang of evildoers has closed in on me; they*ln pierced my hands and my feet.
I*ln can count all my bones; people*ln look and stare at me.
They*ln divided my garments among themselves, and*ln they cast lots for my clothing.
But*pn you, Lord,*s don’t be far away. My*ln strength, come quickly to help me.
Rescue*ln my life from the sword, my*ln only life from the power of these dogs.
Save*ln me from the lion’s mouth, from*ln the horns of wild oxen. You*ln answered me!
I*ln will proclaim your name to my brothers and sisters; I*ln will praise you in the assembly.
You*ln who fear the Lord,*s praise him! All*ln you descendants of Jacob, honor him! All*ln you descendants of Israel, revere him!
For*ln he has not despised or abhorred the*ln torment of the oppressed. He*ln did not hide his face from him but*ln listened when he cried to him for help.
I*pn will give praise in the great assembly because*ln of you; I*ln will fulfill my vows before*ln those who fear you.
The*ln humble will eat and be satisfied; those*ln who seek the Lord*s will praise him. May*ln your hearts live forever!
All*pn the ends of the earth will remember and*ln turn to the Lord.*s All*ln the families of the nations will*ln bow down before you,
for*ln kingship belongs to the Lord;*s he*ln rules the nations.
All*ln who prosper on earth will eat and bow down; all*ln those who go down to the dust will*ln kneel before him — even*ln the one who cannot preserve his life.
Their*ln descendants will serve him; the*ln next generation will be told about the Lord.
They*ln will come and declare his righteousness; to*ln a people yet to be born they*ln will declare what he has done.
